SUPER good, this was my favorite part of the restaurant, fresh baked cannolis YUM! We would go back if we were in the area but nothing super super special -- i still like upper crust better :)

I loved this place!  My Dh and I went there on friday night looking for decent pizza.  We arrived at 6:05pm and the server informed us that there was 25 minutes left of Happy Hour!  Woo Hoo.  Half price wine, beer, mixed drinks AND appetizers!  I ordered TWO glasses of wine and he let me get the HH price, which was cool.

We ordered the full pie - Grandpa's special which was sausage, peppers and onion perfection. We were surprised when the server brought out HALF a pizza.  We wondered if the economy troubles had now reduced pizza to half a pie, but not to worry.  The remaining half stayed piping hot in the kitchen! 

The pizza was huge and delicious. We ended up taking the other half home and the way they package it for you is nothing short of perfect. We just had the other half for dinner after 10 min on the pizza stone and I cant believe how good it was.

Service - perfect. Ambiance - OK. Full bar - SWEET. Pizza - fabulous!

This restaurant is under new ownership and goes by the name, De Nora's. This restaurant is one of the unique venues where the horrible customer service outweighs the great-tasting food. I frequent this restaurant 1, maybe 2 times per week and every time there is something wrong. 

Tonight I called 25 minutes ahead of time and pre-ordered my usual, 1 large cheese pizza. After not being greeted for about 3-4 minutes when I arrived, the older gentleman at the front said "Hello" and went to search for my pizza. The new owner De Nora was there and she told me that the ticket did not print and they'd begin making it right now...not even a simple "I'm sorry". I told them I would wait, and then was presented by the owner with a tab for the full price. After questioning why I was paying full price for a meal that wasn't ready when I arrived, she took $5 off.

I will never go back to this restaurant again!! Absolutely a terrible customer service experience...every time.

We LOVE this place!  Rustica Pizzas are amazing!  Crispy, crunchy, fresh ingredients, yummm.. The Godmother Rustica is on our crave list!  The service is great and attentive.  They are very welcoming!

While visiting family in Arizona, they recommended we pick up some food from Crust to eat while watching the game on TV.  Having a little trouble actually locating the restaurant using Google Maps, we finally found it nestled in the back corner of the shopping plaza.  YAY, time to eat!!  

We arrived to a very cozy pizzeria with limited staff.  However, that did not limit their ability to deliver exceptional service with speed and accuracy.  Having a family member with an actual gluten allergy, not just a hippie trying to be trendy, we were able to get a gluten free option for her to enjoy.  We ordered a pizza with mushrooms and all I have to say is NOM NOM!  The sauce had a light sweetness to it, probably from the type of tomatoes they use, and the crust was lightly salty; a great combination.  It was covered in mozzarella that was simply out of this world.  

Their prices were very reasonable, the restaurant was very clean, and they had a ton of great menu marketing on each table.  I always appreciate seeing a company invest in menu marketing at the tables, because that tells me they are very proud of their food selections to meet all types of consumers.  

Since we travel to Arizona quite a bit, we will certainly come back and most likely have a meal inside of their restaurant instead of doing takeout.  This meal left my mouth watering for more yummy food!

I just moved and was looking for a pizza place to take my kids.  I found Crust and really enjoyed the pizza.  Finally a place outside of New York that calls the pizza a "Pie".   Great Pies...I will be back for more

This is my favorite dine-in restaurant in Phoenix.  My favorite entree is the kale and chicken salad and Mozzarella Carozza appetizer.  My husband always gets the Chicken Francese. It's the best he's ever had. My kids love the homemade Rustica pizza. The crust is so light and crunchy.  The staff is so friendly and seem to take pride in their work. We love it there!

I wish they gave 1/2 stars I would give this a solid 3.5 stars !!! First off I ordered on Sunday because they have a great special for take out right now it's only $10 for a "20 in cheese pizza additional for toppings :) only available during football season I believe ? Well I ordered and it was prob one of the best pizza's I have had in a really long time crunchy crusts the perfect amount of cheese and sauce  . The staff that works in there is friendly it's always slow on Sunday nights it seems so if your not a big fan of crowds would make a great date nite out ? I haven't tried any of there other menu items but want to go there maybe for a girls nite out with some wine.
Food and service was excellent. We had the garlic knots, chicken Parmesan, the original personal pizza and Mac n cheese and EVERYTHING was spot on. Our waiter Justin was excellent. Great experience

The pizza is fantastic!  Prices are reasonable.  And they have great customer service.  The young woman that runs the show, keeps the entire staff on their toes and shows great attention to detail.  Improved location and this place is unstoppable.

Incredible food and service. Had the mozzarella en carozza, chicken franchese and NY rustica.  All were absolutely delicious and we will be back! The marinara sauce on mozzarella was insanely good and the Rustica was best I've had outside the east coast

Yummy place! Very inexpensive, great food & awesome service! The garlic knots are so so so good (and free on your first visit)! So glad this place is near our house! Will definitely be back when we are in the mood for Italian food. PS They have a dog friendly patio!!
They've remained at the top of my pizza and casual Italian choices around. Still usually do their great Sunday/Monday take out deal. Quality and responsiveness, always.

Ordered a pie for pick up, they asked me for my first and last name over the phone..(my first name isn't that common)..I'm thinking why do they need my last name? I walk in to pick up the pie in a very small restaurant and my first and last name is verified (rather loudly), then they call to the back loudly once again) "a pie pick up for my first and last name"...then a guy walk out to hand me my pie stating  my first and last name all within earshot of the whole restaurant.  Call me paranoid but I don't need the whole restaurant to know my full name.  Then I get home with my 25 dollar pie and its cold and nasty.  The worst pizza sauce ever..seriously!!!! It tasted like dominos....I'm from NY and this was no grandma pie..not even the right shape...I threw it out after 1 slice..I don't think Ive ever had to throw out pizza before..I mean cmon how badly can you mess that up..its like messing up a fried egg...I've had pretty good pizza here in AZ thus far...which surprised me......Biancos very good...humble pie also good.  

This place puts my name out on blast and pizza taste like trash....yuk don't waste your time or money!

I came across this restaurant by purchasing a deal-chicken for half off the meal. I would have never came into Crust without the deal; I had driven by it many times and had never even noticed it. They have a small outside patio, and an area inside with a bar. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

The food is great. I had the eggplant rollatini and have gotten it there ever since. I have tried bites of various other dishes (all which have been delicious), but the eggplant rollatini is by far the best.

I have recommended this place to friends and family and they have all enjoyed Crust just as much as I do. If you sign up for to receive their text messages they let you know about deals and happy hour specials. I am very happy that I found this restaurant after all the other deal-chicken fails. :]

This was the best lunch I have ever had. We ordered this at 1100am and were able to pick up by 1120am! The food was fantastic! I got the Eggplant Rollatini, wasn't sure just what I would be getting, but it was A LOT better than I imagined. Eggplant, fresh basil, fresh mozzarella wrapped in  delicious dough! The pizza was to die for and the calazones were perfect. Great bang for your buck! I got 2 lunches from $8 and was satisfied both days.
